verses.verse: Now will I sing <WH7891> to my wellbeloved <WH3039> a song <WH7892> of my beloved <WH1730> touching his vineyard <WH3754>. My wellbeloved <WH3039> has a vineyard <WH3754> in a very fruitful <WH1121> hill <WH7161>:

And he fenced <WH5823> it <WH5619>, and gathered out the stones there <WH5193>, and planted it with the choicest vine <WH8321>, and built <WH1129> a tower <WH4026> in the middle <WH8432> of it <WH2672>, and also made a winepress <WH3342> in it <WH6960>: and he looked that it should bring forth <WH6213> grapes <WH6025>, and it brought forth <WH6213> wild grapes <WH891>.
And now <WH3427>, O inhabitants of Jerusalem <WH3389>, and men <WH376> of Judah <WH3063>, judge <WH8199>, I pray you <WH3754>, between me and my vineyard.

What could have been done <WH6213> more to my vineyard <WH3754>, that I have not done <WH6213> in it <WH4069>? therefore, when I looked <WH6960> that it should bring forth <WH6213> grapes <WH6025>, brought it forth <WH6213> wild grapes <WH891>?

And now go to <WH3045>; I will tell you what I will do <WH6213> to my vineyard <WH3754>: I will take away <WH5493> the hedge <WH4881> there <WH1197>, and it shall be eaten up; and break down <WH6555> the wall <WH1447> there <WH4823>, and it shall be trodden down:

And I will lay <WH7896> it waste <WH1326>: it shall not be pruned <WH2168>, nor dug <WH5737>; but there shall come up <WH5927> briers <WH8068> and thorns <WH7898>: I will also command <WH6680> the clouds <WH5645> that they rain <WH4305> no rain upon it <WH4306>.

For the vineyard <WH3754> of the Lord <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> is the house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478>, and the men <WH376> of Judah <WH3063> his pleasant <WH8191> plant <WH5194>: and he looked <WH6960> for judgment <WH4941>, but behold oppression <WH4939>; for righteousness <WH6666>, but behold a cry <WH6818>.

Woe <WH1945> unto them that join <WH5060> house <WH1004> to house <WH1004>, that lay <WH7126> field <WH7704> to field <WH7704>, until there be no <WH657> place <WH4725>, that they may be placed <WH3427> alone in the middle <WH7130> of the earth <WH776>!

In my ears <WH241> said the Lord <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, Of a truth <WH3808> many <WH7227> houses <WH1004> shall be desolate <WH8047>, even great <WH1419> and fair <WH2896>, without inhabitant <WH3427>.
Yes <WH3588>, ten <WH6235> acres <WH6776> of vineyard <WH3754> shall yield <WH6213> one <WH259> bath <WH1324>, and the seed <WH2233> of a homer <WH2563> shall yield <WH6213> a ephah <WH374>.

Woe <WH1945> unto them that rise up early <WH7925> in the morning <WH1242>, that they may follow <WH7291> strong drink <WH7941>; that continue <WH309> until night <WH5399>, until wine <WH3196> inflame them <WH1814>!

And the harp <WH3658>, and the lyre <WH5035>, the tabret <WH8596>, and flute <WH2485>, and wine <WH3196>, are in their feasts <WH4960>: but they regard <WH5027> not the work <WH6467> of the Lord <WH3068>, neither consider <WH7200> the operation <WH4639> of his hands <WH3027>.

Therefore my people <WH5971> are gone into captivity <WH1540>, because they have no knowledge <WH1847>: and their honorable <WH3519> men <WH4962> are famished <WH7458>, and their multitude <WH1995> dried up <WH6704> with thirst <WH6772>.

Therefore Sheol <WH7585> has enlarged <WH7337> herself <WH5315>, and opened <WH6473> her mouth <WH6310> without measure <WH2706>: and their glory <WH1926>, and their multitude <WH1995>, and their pomp <WH7588>, and he that rejoices <WH5938>, shall descend into it <WH3381>.
And the mean man <WH120> shall be brought down <WH7817>, and the mighty man <WH376> shall be humbled <WH8213>, and the eyes <WH5869> of the lofty <WH1364> shall be humbled <WH8213>:
But the Lord <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> shall be exalted <WH1361> in judgment <WH4941>, and God <WH410> that is holy <WH6918> shall be sanctified <WH6942> in righteousness <WH6666>.
Then shall the lambs <WH3532> feed <WH7462> after their manner <WH1699>, and the waste places <WH2723> of the fat ones <WH4220> shall strangers <WH1481> eat <WH398>.
Woe <WH1945> unto them that draw <WH4900> iniquity <WH5771> with cords <WH2256> of vanity <WH7723>, and sin <WH2403> as it were with a cart <WH5699> rope <WH5688>:

That say <WH559>, Let him make speed <WH4116>, and hasten <WH2363> his work <WH4639>, that we may see <WH7200> it <WH6098>: and let the counsel of the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478> draw near <WH7126> and come <WH935>, that we may know it <WH3045>!

Woe <WH1945> unto them that call <WH559> evil <WH7451> good <WH2896>, and good <WH2896> evil <WH7451>; that put <WH7760> darkness <WH2822> for light <WH216>, and light <WH216> for darkness <WH2822>; that put <WH7760> bitter <WH4751> for sweet <WH4966>, and sweet <WH4966> for bitter <WH4751>!
Woe <WH1945> unto them that are wise <WH2450> in their own eyes <WH5869>, and prudent <WH995> in their own sight <WH6440>!
Woe <WH1945> unto them that are mighty <WH1368> to drink <WH8354> wine <WH3196>, and men <WH582> of strength <WH2428> to mingle <WH4537> strong drink <WH7941>:
Which justify <WH6663> the wicked <WH7563> for <WH6118> reward <WH7810>, and take away <WH5493> the righteousness <WH6666> of the righteous from him <WH6662>!

Therefore as the fire <WH784> devours <WH398> the stubble <WH7179>, and the flame <WH3956> consumes <WH7503> the chaff <WH2842>, so their root <WH8328> shall be as rottenness <WH4716>, and their blossom <WH6525> shall go up <WH5927> as dust <WH80>: because they have cast away <WH3988> the law <WH8451> of the Lord <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, and despised <WH5006> the word <WH565> of the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478>.

Therefore is the anger <WH639> of the Lord <WH3068> kindled <WH2734> against his people <WH5971>, and he has stretched forth <WH5186> his hand <WH3027> against them <WH5221>, and has struck them <WH2022>: and the hills did tremble <WH7264>, and their carcasses <WH5038> were torn <WH5478> in the middle <WH7130> of the streets <WH2351>. For all this his anger <WH639> is not turned away <WH7725>, but his hand <WH3027> is stretched out still <WH5186>.

And he will lift up <WH5375> a ensign <WH5251> to the nations <WH1471> from far <WH7350>, and will hiss <WH8319> unto them from the end <WH7097> of the earth <WH776>: and <WH935>, behold, they shall come with speed <WH4120> swiftly <WH7031>:

None shall be weary <WH5889> nor stumble <WH3782> among them <WH5123>; none shall slumber nor sleep <WH3462>; neither shall the belt <WH232> of their body <WH2504> be loosened <WH6605>, nor the latchet <WH8288> of their shoes <WH5275> be broken <WH5423>:

Whose arrows <WH2671> are sharp <WH8150>, and all their bows <WH7198> bent <WH1869>, their horses <WH5483>' hoofs <WH6541> shall be counted <WH2803> like flint <WH6862>, and their wheels <WH1534> like a whirlwind <WH5492>:

Their roaring <WH7581> shall be like a lion <WH3833>, they shall roar <WH7580> like young lions <WH3715>: Yes <WH5098>, they shall roar, and lay hold <WH270> of the prey <WH2964>, and shall carry it away safe <WH6403>, and none shall deliver it <WH5337>.

And in that day <WH3117> they shall roar <WH5098> against them like the roaring <WH5100> of the sea <WH3220>: and if one look <WH5027> unto the land <WH776>, behold darkness <WH2822> and sorrow <WH6862>, and the light <WH216> is darkened <WH2821> in the heavens there <WH6183>.
